Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: If any NN ops have run into a coredump on block 99972 on HUSH, plz let me know: https://github.com/MyHush/hush3/issues/36

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It actually dumps core in processing block 99973, but the last log line will be about 99972

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: all good on my node

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: It seems to effect many GUI wallet users, but no mining pools, exchanges or NNs have reported anything. Just wanted to make sure, in case a few NNs saw weird stuff

Author: scubapanda#2485
Content:
`./komodod -ac_name=HUSH3 -ac_sapling=1 -ac_reward=0,1125000000,562500000 -ac_halving=129,340000,840000 -ac_end=128,340000,5422111 -ac_eras=3 -ac_blocktime=150 -ac_cc=2 -ac_ccenable=228,234,235,236,241 -ac_founders=1 -ac_supply=6178674 -ac_perc=11111111 -clientname=GoldenSandtrout -addnode=188.165.212.101 -addnode=136.243.227.142 -addnode=5.9.224.250 -ac_cclib=hush3 -ac_script=76a9145eb10cf64f2bab1b457f1f25e658526155928fac88ac
` crashes at UpdateTip: new best=000000031ece79e133074ee37257148e2c9ff8e7fb48d64f601fc40b1ef92c7c  height=99972

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yup

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that is the problem i have been debugging for days

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you just need something that works, you can use a stock `komodod`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: normal komodod won't work either

Author: Alright#0419
Content: fresh sync fails on every branch, just don't fresh sync 😅

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
fwiw: the HUSH issue predates any code prior to Feb 15
that's as far as I went back (the "piece of dog shit" that I am)

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yep, pretty damn old

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: strange, i'm doing a fresh sync on pirate from dev branch.. going strong

Author: Alright#0419
Content: not going to affect pirate unless a notary did something similar

Author: Alright#0419
Content: needs to spend the utxos from a z->t in the same block

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: but then again we don't have z->t

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the stock `komodod` binaries generated from CI can sync HUSH3

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not sure why normal `komodod` master doesn't have HUSH3 stuff yet, but that is @jl777c 's decision

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: master is updated only very rarely and it is handy for cases like this, as we can know that it worked as of last master update

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, managing risk is very real

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: beta branch is the NN branch anyway

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c there is an interesting diff between beta and FSM

Author: dukeleto#7326
dukeleto#7326
Content: my question is, why were those lines needed?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: did @Mihailo run into these same problems, and fix it just for pegsCC ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: those 3 `ifs` skip the code that coredumps in Hush

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it might be that a similar `continue` is needed for this case of zutxo-derived funds that are being spent from mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pegs has some very special "inputs" that are actually not utxo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but, yes some sort of special case check is needed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ok, so for different reasons. But maybe the same check in a few places is needed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: "if we are spending from the mempool, and the txid we are spending comes from zutxo inputs, skip the `IsAvailable` check in `GetOutputFor`"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c does something like that sound reasonable?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe IsAvailable should allow all zinputs and not require it be a taddr utxo?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure, this is code i havent changed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it seems it is just a mempool issue, so maybe a special case in the mempool accept is sufficient

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, i am not sure the exact logic of the special condition. I guess we need to make sure the same thing doesn't happen when not spending from the mempool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: spending of z->t outputs is working, except in this edge case

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the issue exists in master branch as well

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I doubt that diff you posted has anything to do with it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think i know how the chain confirmed it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: only nodes that saw the tx in the mempool in realtime accepted the block.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any node that had to sync, likely hit the error

Author: Alright#0419
Content: can test that

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how?

Author: Alright#0419
Content: make a node not see it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: interesting edge cases, for sure

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I'll test it right now, will be simple enough

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`only nodes that saw the tx in the mempool in realtime accepted the block.
any node that had to sync, likely hit the error`
that seems to hold as nodes that were live then cannot fresh sync now with 0 code changes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: my theory is that only the nodes that saw it in their mempool when the critical block was mined, accepted it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Hush probably has the highest transaction volume of any KMD smartchain that allows these kinds of transactions, so statistically we were most likely to hit this bug

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i dont see how you can replicate this

Author: Alright#0419
Content: I'll do it, 30 minutes or so
